meanings.definition: A person or entity that pays someone for services rendered.
meanings.sent1: The generous remunerators at the company always make sure to pay their employees on time.
meanings.sent2: The remunerators in the business world play a crucial role in ensuring fair compensation for workers.
meanings.sent3: The remunerators decided to give the hardworking employees a surprise bonus for their dedication.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the remunerators are like the conductors of a symphony, harmonizing pay and performance.
meanings.sent5: The image of the remunerators handing out paychecks is etched in the minds of the employees.

meanings.definition: Those who provide compensation or rewards for work or services.
meanings.sent1: The kind remunerators at the charity organization ensure that volunteers feel appreciated for their efforts.
meanings.sent2: It is important for remunerators to acknowledge the hard work of individuals and reward them accordingly.
meanings.sent3: The remunerators surprised the team with a pizza party as a token of appreciation for their dedication.
meanings.sent4: The remunerators' recognition acts as a motivational fuel, driving employees to excel in their tasks.
meanings.sent5: The remunerators' role is to sprinkle gratitude and recognition among the workforce.
